        Constructor of the library

    • Method Detail

      • createNode

        public int createNode(int id,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String data)
        Create a new Node object with the id, name and data passed as parameters. It also adds the new node into the global Nodes HashMap with the id as key and the node itself as value.
        Parameters:
        id - The node's ID as an integer
        name - The node's name as a string
        data - The node's data as a string
        Returns:
        0 as signal that everything went OK

      • createNodeXY

        public int createNodeXY(int id,
                        java.lang.String name,
                        double x,
                        double y,
                        java.lang.String data)
        Same as createNode but with two extra parameters that represent the coordinates in the Cartesian plane.
        Parameters:
        id - The node's ID as an integer
        name - The node's name as a string
        x - The node's x coordinate as a double
        y - The node's y coordinate as a double
        data - The node's data as a string
        Returns:
        return 0 as signal that everything went OK

      • createEdge

        public int createEdge(int id,
                      Node a,
                      Node b,
                      java.lang.String data,
                      int dir)
        Creates an object Edge with the data passed as parameters. It also adds the object to the global Edges HashMap and updates the grades of the nodes passed as parameters accordingly if the edge is directed or not.
        Parameters:
        id - The edge ID as an integer
        a - The node 'a' connected by the edge as a Node object
        b - The node 'b' connected by the edge as a Node object
        data - The data of the edge as a string
        dir - Integer that defines if the edge is directed. If dir is equal to 0 the edge si not directed, otherwise is directed.
        Returns:
        0 as an indicator that everything went OK.

      • createTreeEdge

        public int createTreeEdge(int id,
                          Node a,
                          Node b,
                          java.lang.String data)
        Creates an edge with the data passed as parameters. It adds the edge to the global treeEdges HashMap which is useful when we export a Tree Graph
        Parameters:
        id - The edge ID as an integer.
        a - The Node 'a' of the edge.
        b - The Node 'b' of the edge.
        data - The edge data as a string.
        Returns:
        0 if everything was OK.

      • getGradNode

        public int getGradNode(Node node)
        Getter function to retrieve the grad of a Node
        Parameters:
        node - The Node object to retrieve the grad from.
        Returns:
        The grad of the Node as an integer.

      • createNodes

        public void createNodes(int n)
        Helper function to create as much nodes as the passed parameter. It creates the nodes with the name set as 'Node i' where i represents its id. And the data is set as 'No data'. This should be changed accordingly.
        Parameters:
        n - An integer that tells how many nodes to create.

      • sieveNodes

        public void sieveNodes()
        Helper function to set how many actual nodes are in the graph. This is useful at the moment of loading a graph from file. Since there exists a possibility a node is never connected, the biggest ID usually does not match the number of nodes in the graph. This function sets to a global variable 'reachableNodes' the actual number of useful nodes.

      • createNodesFromFile

        public void createNodesFromFile(java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> nodesFromFile)
        Helper function to create the nodes in a graph loaded from a file.
        Parameters:
        nodesFromFile - Is a Set which contains the IDs of the nodes to create.

      • createNodesXY

        public void createNodesXY(int n)
        Same as createNodes but this time it also sets the x and y coordinates randomly with values ranging from 0 to 1.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of nodes to create as an integer.

      • Erdos

        public Graph Erdos(int n,
                   int m,
                   int dir,
                   int cic)
        It performs the Erdös-Renyi algorithm to create a random graph.
        Parameters:
        n - It represents the number of nodes to create, as an integer.
        m - It represents the number of distinct edges to create, as an integer.
        dir - It represents if the graph is directed. 0 means no directed, any other number means it is directed.
        cic - If is 0, it means an edge that connects a node to itself is not allowed. Any other number will allow self connections.
        Returns:
        The created graph as a Graph object.

      • Gilbert

        public Graph Gilbert(int n,
                     double p,
                     int dir,
                     int cic)
        It performs the Gilbert algorithm to create a random graph.
        Parameters:
        n - It represents the number of nodes to create, as an integer.
        p - Double less than 1 representing the threshold to pass so an edge can be created.
        dir - It represents if the graph is directed. 0 means no directed, any other number means it is directed.
        cic - If is 0, it means an edge that connects a node to itself is not allowed. Any other number will allow self connections.
        Returns:
        The created graph as a Graph object.

      • Geo

        public Graph Geo(int n,
                 double r,
                 int dir,
                 int cic)
        It performs the Geographic algorithm to create a random graph.
        Parameters:
        n - It represents the number of nodes to create, as an integer.
        r - Double less than square root of 2 representing the threshold to not pass so an edge can be created.
        dir - It represents if the graph is directed. 0 means no directed, any other number means it is directed.
        cic - If is 0, it means an edge that connects a node to itself is not allowed. Any other number will allow self connections.
        Returns:
        The created graph as a Graph object.

      • Barabasi

        public Graph Barabasi(int n,
                      int d,
                      double g,
                      int dir,
                      int cic)
        It performs the Geographic algorithm to create a random graph.
        Parameters:
        n - It represents the number of nodes to create, as an integer.
        d - The expected degree of each node.
        g - Hyper parameter of the algorithm.
        dir - It represents if the graph is directed. 0 means no directed, any other number means it is directed.
        cic - If is 0, it means an edge that connects a node to itself is not allowed. Any other number will allow self connections.
        Returns:
        The created graph as a Graph object.

      • getNodesGraph

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Node> getNodesGraph()
        Getter function to retrieve the HashMap that contains the Nodes in the graph. With key the node ID.
        Returns:
        HashMap

      • getEdgesGraph

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Edge> getEdgesGraph()
        Getter function to retrieve the HashMap that contains the Edges in the graph. With key the edge ID.
        Returns:
        HashMap

      • graphGraph

        public int graphGraph(Graph grapho,
                      int dir,
                      java.lang.String name)
        Function to save the Graph object as a '.gv' file in the location and with the name set by the user.
        Parameters:
        grapho - The Graph object to be saved as file.
        dir - An integer which controls if the graph is not directed (dir == 0) or directed (any other value).
        name - The name for the file passed as parameter. It is override by the user while saving.
        Returns:
        1 if everything went fine. Otherwise 0.

      • getEdgesTree

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Edge> getEdgesTree()
        Getter function to retrieve the treeEdges HashMap. It is used when saving a graph that is actually a tree.
        Returns:
        HashMap

      • graphTree

        public int graphTree(Graph grafo,
                     java.lang.String name)
        As graphGraph but is saves a Tree.
        Parameters:
        grafo - Graph object to be saved into a file.
        name - The name of the file passed as parameter. Override by the user while saving.
        Returns:
        1 if everything went fine. Otherwise 0.

      • readGraph

        public int readGraph(Graph grafo)
        Loads into memory a graph from a '.gv' file.
        Parameters:
        grafo - It needs a Graph object to manipulate its global parameters. This is probably a horrible practice an cumbersome. The program should be changed to improve this. Did not care at the time, as long as it was functional.
        Returns:
        1 if everything was fine. 0 if something failed.

      • resetNodes

        public void resetNodes(Graph grafo)
        Resets the Node.visited field to false of every single node in the graph.
        Parameters:
        grafo - Graph object to whose nodes will be reseted.

      • resetTree

        public void resetTree(Graph grafo)
        It cleans the treeEdges HashMap.
        Parameters:
        grafo - Graph object to whose treeEdges will be reseted.

      • BFS

        public void BFS(Graph grafo,
                Node root)
        It performs the Broad First Search algorithm to the graph.
        Parameters:
        grafo - Graph object to whom the algorithm will be applied.
        root - The root node where the algorithm starts.

      • DFS_R

        public int DFS_R(Graph grafo,
                 Node root)
        It performs the Deep First Search recursive algorithm to the graph.
        Parameters:
        grafo - Graph object to whom the algorithm will be applied.
        root - The root node where the algorithm starts.
        Returns:
        The ID of the root node. Needed for the recursive stage.

      • DFS_I

        public void DFS_I(Graph grafo,
                  Node root)
        * It performs the Deep First Search iterative algorithm to the graph.
        Parameters:
        grafo - Graph object to whom the algorithm will be applied.
        root - The root node where the algorithm starts.

      • setEdgeWeights

        public void setEdgeWeights(double min,
                           double max,
                           boolean onlyInteger)
        Sets the weight to each Edge in a random fashion. It also calls the function graphWeightedGraph() to save the weighted graph.
        Parameters:
        min - The minimum value a weight can have.
        max - The maximum value a weight can have.
        onlyInteger - If is 1 the weights will be only integers.

      • graphWeightedGraph

        public int graphWeightedGraph()
        It saves to a file the weighted graph.
        Returns:
        1 if everything was fine. 0 otherwise.

      • Dijkstra

        public void Dijkstra(Graph grafo,
                     Node s)
        It performs the Dijkstra algorithm to the graph.
        Parameters:
        grafo - The graph to whom the algorithm will be performed.
        s - The root node.

      • graphDijkstra

        public int graphDijkstra(Graph grafo,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> prev,
                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Double> dist)
        Saves to a file the tree found by Dijkstra.
        Parameters:
        grafo - The graph object to be saved as a file.
        name - The name of the file. This will be override by the user while saving.
        prev - The HashMap that contains all the parents.
        dist - The HashMap that contains all the distances.
        Returns:
        1 if everything was fine. 0 otherwise.

      • graphMST

        public int graphMST(Graph grafo,
                    java.lang.String name,
                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Edge> mst)
        Saves to file the Minimum Spanning Tree.
        Parameters:
        grafo - The graph to be saved.
        name - The name of the file. Override by the user while saving.
        mst - The minimum spanning tree as a HashMap
        Returns:
        1 if everything was OK. 0 otherwise.

      • kruskal

        public void kruskal(Graph grafo)
        It performs the Kruskal's algorithm to the graph.
        Parameters:
        grafo - The graph to whom the algorithm will be applied.

      • find

        public int find(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> prev,
                int idNode)
        Auxiliar function for Kruskal
        Parameters:
        prev - HashMap of the previous.
        idNode - ID of the node.
        Returns:
        the id of the node.

      • union

        public void union(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> prev,
                  int x,
                  int y)
        Another helper function for Kruskal
        Parameters:
        prev - HashMap of the previous.
        x - To find parents.
        y - To find parents.

      • inverseKruskal

        public boolean inverseKruskal(Graph grafo,
                              Node s)
        It performs the inverse Kruskal algorithm.
        Parameters:
        grafo - The graph to whom the algorithm will be applied.
        s - The node to start from.
        Returns:
        true if this algorithm can be performed to the graph. false if it can not be performed, i.e. the graph is not connected.

      • checkAllVisited

        public boolean checkAllVisited()
        Helper function to check if all nodes were visited.
        Returns:
        true if all nodes were visited. false otherwise.

      • prim

        public boolean prim(Graph grafo,
                    Node s)
        It performs the Prim's algorithm.
        Parameters:
        grafo - The graph to whom the algorithm will be applied.
        s - The node to start from.
        Returns:
        true if this algorithm can be performed to the graph. false if it can not be performed, i.e. the graph is not connected.

      • FFT

        public void FFT(java.nio.file.Path path)
         throws java.io.IOException,
                WavFileException
        Performs everything needed for the FFT in 'real time'. Due to the library used, only certain type of WAV files are supported. You should try and find which ones.
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the '.wav' file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - See documentation in Java.
        WavFileException - See documentation in the WAV library.

      • FFTStatic

        public void FFTStatic(java.nio.file.Path path)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      WavFileException
        Performs everything needed for the static FFT. Due to the library used, only certain type of WAV files are supported. You should try and find which ones.
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the '.wav' file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - See documentation in Java.
        WavFileException - See documentation in the WAV library.

      • fft

        public Complex[] fft(Complex[] x)
        Performs the FFT to an array of complex values.
        Parameters:
        x - The Complex[] array of values.
        Returns:
        Complex[] representing the FFT of x.

      • ifft

        public Complex[] ifft(Complex[] x)
        Performs the IFFT to an array of complex values.
        Parameters:
        x - The Complex[] array of values.
        Returns:
        Complex[] representing the IFFT of x.

      • SLS

        public void SLS()
        Performs the entirety Segmented Least Squares algorithm.

      • Coef

        public javafx.util.Pair Coef(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> x,
                             java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> y)
        Calculates the coefficients for the LS algorithm.
        Parameters:
        x - ArrayList of the x coordinates.
        y - ArrayList of the y coordinates.
        Returns:
        Pair(a,b) of the coefficients used in the LS algorithm.

      • ErrorXY

        public double ErrorXY(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> x,
                      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> y,
                      double a,
                      double b)
        Calculates the Error for the SLS.
        Parameters:
        x - ArrayList of the x coordinates.
        y - ArrayList of the y coordinates.
        a - The coefficient 'a' for the SLS.
        b - The coefficient 'b' for the SLS.
        Returns:
        A double representing the error of the SLS iteration.
